page.title: 15HARLESTON HOUSE - LOWESTOFT
page.content: Harleston House was opened in 1945 and is run by the Church Army. It is a home for elderly people and it has 30 residents, each with their own bedroom. The oldest resident is 102 and the youngest is 67. The rents are set by the council at 110 pounds per week. The pensions are collected for the residents. The residents enjoy knitting, sewing, embroidery and gardening. The house is set in a large garden and there are rooms for visitors. If anyone is ill at night there is a bell in each room which is connected to the office - there is a doctors surgery nearby. Harleston House is a lovely building and everybody seemed very happy there.
